docs.lead_paragraph: Mariya and Leonid Livshyts, both in their 70s, moved to Atlanta from Ukraine in 2008, but health issues and financial troubles drove them to New York.

headline.main: Moving to Be Near Their Daughters, but Still Far Away
headline.print_headline: Moving to Be Near Their Daughters, but Still Far Away

docs.abstract: Selfhelp Community Services, beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, assists Ukrainian immigrants Leonid and Mariya Livshyts of Brooklyn with paying their rent.

headline.main: Part D for Drug Coverage — and Drudgery

docs.abstract: Like doing our taxes, signing up for Medicare Part D, the insurance program for drug coverage, takes days out of our lives and leaves us sitting in a heap of papers with a splitting headache.

docs.lead_paragraph: Trump Entertainment Resorts says it is closing its newest hotel tower and is no longer issuing credit as it prepares for a Dec. 12 shutdown of the Taj Mahal, its lone remaining casino.
